alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 2:12AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Kenedy and north central Willacy Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 212 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of San Perlita, or 11 miles northwest of Port Mansfield, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Mansfield, Port Mansfield Chamber Of Commerce and Port Mansfield Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
